intro: Psychotria meridianomontana var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
